qas.question: When do the pictograms suggest Sumerians had domesticated livestock?
What was the primary purpose of oxen for Sumerians?
What animal did Sumerians use primary to facilitate transportation?
What might be found by the side of a Sumerian house?

answers.text: enclosed garden planted with trees and other plants

qas.question: Where were plants also grown besides the garden?
What animals were domesticated following the Uruk period?
Who used donkeys as beasts of burden?
Who first grew plants in pots?
What writing form was invented by the Sumerian?

context: In the early <b6_0><b7_0>Sumerian<b7_0/><b6_0/> <a0_0>Uruk period<a0_0/>, the primitive <b8_0>pictograms<b8_0/> suggest that <b5_0>sheep, goats, cattle, and pigs<b5_0/> were domesticated. They used oxen as their primary <a1_0>beasts of burden<a1_0/> and <a2_0>donkeys<a2_0/> or equids as their primary transport animal and "woollen clothing as well as rugs were made from the wool or hair of the animals. ... By the side of the house was an <a3_0>enclosed garden planted with trees and other plants<a3_0/>; wheat and probably other cereals were sown in the fields, and the shaduf was already employed for the purpose of irrigation. Plants were also grown in <a4_0>pots or vases<a4_0/>."
